identificationModule.officialTitle: MINT Registry : Macrowire for IntracraNial Thrombectomy Registry

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Assistant Clinical Professor Of Neurology, Neurological Surgery and Radiology

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this study is to develop a multicenter registry of patient data and outcomes for patients undergoing intracranial thrombectomy for acute ischemic stroke secondary to emergent large vessel occlusion with delivery of reperfusion catheter over a novel macrowire (Aristotle Colossus) to perform intracranial mechanical thrombectomy.

armGroups.label: Participants with emergent large vessel occlusion undegoing intracranial mechanical thromebctomy
armGroups.description: Participants with emergent large vessel occlusion undergoing intracranial mechanical thrombectomy where the reperfusion catheter was delivered over a macrowire to perform thrombectomy.

interventions.name: No Intervention
armGroupLabels: Participants with emergent large vessel occlusion undegoing intracranial mechanical thromebctomy

primaryOutcomes.measure: Ability to deliver reperfusion catheter to the intracranial occlusion with macrowire alone (Yes/No)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time from vascular access to first intracranial pass (minutes)
Time from vascular access to recanalization (minutes)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Age \>18-85 years Time of onset \< 24 hours Acute stroke patient with NIHSS \>6 CT-ASPECTS â‰¥ 6 Proven intracranial occlusion - (ICA-T, M1) Modified Rankin score: 0-2

Exclusion Criteria:

Age \<18 years or \>85 years Unknown time of onset NIHSS \< 5 CT ASPECTS \<5 Pre-stroke morbidity, modified Rankin score \> 2 Tandem occlusion
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Subjects aged 18-85 years will be identified once they undergo mechanical thrombectomy for large vessel occlusion where delivery of reperfusion catheter over macrowire alone was performed.
